body.p: “At the Pout’s Nest “,” Walden “,” I find the Scirpus debilis “,” apparently in prime “,” generally aslant; also the Cyperus dentatus “,” with some spikes changed into leafy tufts; also here less advanced what I have called Juncus acuminatus.”
PE 14, pg. 138/ 9 July 1858-9 November 1858 / NNPM MA 1302:33 / T vol. # XXVII / PDF # XVII / JXI
